body_html: I'd like to mention that although the Java API doesn't include a lot of features like auto-differentiation, I haven't found this to be a barrier for my own work. I've had great success generating a model in python, serializing it to a .proto file, and then opening it through the Java wrapper for training. The same can be done for test-time, since I believe the Saver functionality is available through the C++ and Java APIs.

body: I'd like to mention that although the Java API doesn't include a lot of features like auto-differentiation, I haven't found this to be a barrier for my own work. I've had great success generating a model in python, serializing it to a .proto file, and then opening it through the Java wrapper for training. The same can be done for test-time, since I believe the Saver functionality is available through the C++ and Java APIs.
